---
title: "Services"
---

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE)

```
-	**Atmospheric chemistry**: Hazardous air pollutants (air toxics), volatile 
organic compounds (VOCs), speciated particulate matter, near-road pollution
-	**Interactive dashboard development**: R Shiny, Rmarkdown, and API development
    + [EPA NCore dashboard](https://sti-r-shiny.shinyapps.io/NCORE_Dashboard/)
    + [EPA PM FRM QA dashboard](https://sti-r-shiny.shinyapps.io/QVA_Dashboard/)
    + [EPA ozone QA dashboard](https://sti-r-shiny.shinyapps.io/ozone_dashboard/)
-	**Monitoring and network services**: Study design, network assessment, risk assessment,
community-scale monitoring, environmental justice
- **Statistical analysis**: Regressions, source apportionment, hypothesis testing, cluster analysis, trend analysis, time-series analysis, geospatial analysis/GIS, distributions, model building, data mining
- **Quality assurance**: Quality management plans (QMPs),  Quality assurance project plans (QAPPs), and automated QA/QC algorithms
- **Training**: Statistics, R, atmospheric science, and community-monitoring


```{r quals_processing, include=FALSE}
library(readxl)
library(tidyverse)
#import and process Qualifications table
quals_table <- read_excel('./images/quals.xlsx', sheet = 'RR_LLC') %>%
  select(ProjectName,Contact, Year, 'Atmospheric Chemistry', 'Statistical Analysis',
         'Monitoring and Network services', 'QA QC', 'Dashboard', 'Training', 'International') %>%
  arrange(desc(Year))

```

```{r quals_table, layout="l-body-outset"}
#Display qualifications table
library(DT)
DT::datatable(quals_table,
  caption  = 'Table of qualifications - selected categories. Each category can be searched individually or in combination using the search box below the column name.',
  rownames=FALSE,
  options = list(autoWidth = FALSE, dom = 'tp',
    pageLength = 10),
  filter = list(position='top', clear=FALSE)) %>%
  formatStyle(names(quals_table),
    Color = styleEqual(c('x', NA), c('orange', 'white'))
    )
```
